content.webTitle: The Populist: The column that looks after its circus elephant

fields.headline: The Populist: The column that looks after its circus elephant
fields.bodyText: Xbox 1960 Season five of Mad Men may be uncertain, but you can play spot the Sterling Cooper cameo in the trailer for Rockstar's retro newie LA Noire, due 20 May. BOBtropolis Airplanes/Price Tag rapper B.o.B responds to Tyler, The Creator's diss in Yonkers, sticking it back to him on the track No Future. Standout line: "Got my own city/ You can call it Bobtropolis." Late-90s FM rock joke of the week The surprisingly decent trailer for Timberlake/Kunis sex-com Friends With Benefits features a gag confusing Third Eye Blind with Semisonic. What, no Matchbox Twenty? Scottish pipes Pixar's new Highlands fling Brave has gone authentic, losing fake Scot Reese Witherspoon and signing real Scot Kelly Macdonald up as the lead. The next big thing. And the next. And the next American Idol's on, X Factor USA auditions have started, and Christian Aguilera's gearing up to find The Voice. America had better have talent, or we're in for a long summer. S&MUM Rihanna's new TV spot for her album tones down the smut to push it as a Mother's Day gift. Next, Ke$ha wakes up in the morning with a bottle of milk. twitter.com/guideguardian guardianguide.tumblr.com
